Header: Prime Minister arrives in the Maldives
Content: The 13 member delegation led by Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe that left on a three-day official tour of the Maldives has arrived at the Velana International Airport at 7.30 this morning. The delegation was received by Maldivian Foreign Minister Abdulla Shaheed. Prime Minister Wickremesinghe left for the Maldives on an invitation extended to him by President Ibrahim Mohamed Saali. Sri Lanka and the Maldives expect to sign four agreements including visa facilities between the two countries, social security, vocational training and youth development, during the official tour of Prime Minister Wickremesinghe. Meanwhile, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe will chair the Indian Ocean Summit to be held tomorrow and day after at Paradise Island Resort in the Maldives.
